body:
If you want to collect statistical data about benchmark A it makes sense to minimize noise in the results by grouping all A runs together, no? 

I don't get why ABABAB would be less biased. If the machine is busy at the beginning (AB----) and free at the end (----AB) you'll get huge variance on both A and B results. If you run like AAABBB then it does not really matter if the machine is busy on not, because A is always run in the same conditions, and same for B.
